Troubleshooting Amazon Brand Analytics Permissions

Troubleshooting Amazon Brand Analytics Permissions

Written by Openbridge Support

Updated over a week ago

Amazon Search Terms, Market Basket, and Repeat Purchase reports are part of
Brand Analytics. As a result, these report is only available to sellers or
vendors who own a brand (see Amazon Brand Registry). Per Amazon, an
**_authorizing Seller Central or Vendor Central account must be internal to
the brand and responsible for selling the brand in the Amazon store._**

Here is an example of a permission error you may see if you are access
restricted:

##  **Checking Your Permissions**

  *  **Sellers:** If you are not able to access Brand Analytics, go to the Brand Benefit Eligibility page where you can click ‘ **Review my eligibility** ’ to correct your status and gain access to Brand Analytics reports.

  *  **Vendors: Confirm your brand is registered in** Amazon Brand Registry. Also, make sure the authorizing user account has all reporting access types (Operations, Finance, Digital, etc.) enabled.

## **Fixing Permissions Issues**

 **Sellers**

If you see an error message stating “You do not have permission to access this
page,” request the Primary Account Administrator grant you permission to
“Amazon Brand Analytics” on the Global User Permissions page.

You may also see the following notice on the Brand Benefit Eligibility page:

  *  _You are designated as a secondary user and do not have permission to view this page._

To resolve this, you must contact the Primary Account Administrator to grant
"View" permissions under - _Settings - > User Permissions -> Manage Global
Permissions -> Select user_ and set the status to “View” for “Brand Benefit
Eligibility” under the “Performance” category.

**Vendors**

To validate permissions in your vendor account, please check your permissions
as shown below. Unlike Sellers, there is no Brand Benefits page in Vendor
Central. As a result, you need to assess the permissions granted to your
Vendor Central user account.

For additional permissions information, see How To Configure Amazon Selling
Partner Permissions or Troubleshooting SP-API User Permissions.
